I had a little qweary , is it normal that in a crowded space I get so overwhelmed when it‚Äôs loud (I‚Äôm autistic) but I can‚Äôt actually hear what people are saying ? It‚Äôs like a wall of sound but nothing I can hear , is this normal for hearing loss and autism ?

title: Is this autistic burnout?
text:
I‚Äôm posting here because I strongly suspect I‚Äôm on the autism spectrum, and what I‚Äôm dealing with lately doesn‚Äôt feel like just depression or anxiety. It feels like something deeper‚Äîmaybe autistic burnout. I want to hear from people who‚Äôve been through something similar or understand this condition better than the psychiatrists and therapists I‚Äôve seen over the years.

Here‚Äôs where I‚Äôm at:

I‚Äôm absolutely miserable. This has been most of my life, but it‚Äôs gotten significantly worse in the past few years. I‚Äôve been unemployed and isolated for about two years. During that time, my sensory sensitivities have exploded‚Äîlight and sound feel overwhelming, especially in crowded places like malls, and it drains me physically and mentally to the point of feeling lightheaded, like I‚Äôm about to collapse. I used to cope with depression before, but now it feels different.

Even after resting and trying to ‚Äúget better‚Äù for years, I can‚Äôt seem to move forward. I come up with ideas and plans to improve my life and finances, but I immediately freak out and abandon them. I‚Äôm stuck in a loop of doing nothing, and even things that used to bring me joy feel flat and pointless.

I‚Äôve tried therapy many times, but most psychiatrists and psychologists I‚Äôve seen don‚Äôt seem to understand autism in my country‚Äîthey often dismiss or misunderstand what I‚Äôm going through and prescribe SSRIs that do absolutely nothing and sometimes even worsen my condition.

My anxiety has become unbearable, and suicidal ideation has been a loud, persistent voice since late last year. I‚Äôm completely isolated‚Äîrarely leaving my apartment and going days or weeks without human contact.

I feel disconnected and disillusion from everyone and everything. Attempts to form meaningful relationships fall apart because I‚Äôm ‚Äútoo intense‚Äù for most people. I‚Äôm tired of pretending to fit in and wearing masks. I struggle with being too honest and too literal, and I also think in an existentialist way that often clashes with those around me. I live in a very closed-minded culture, and I‚Äôm too individualistic for it. I have no support‚Äî even my ‚Äúfamily‚Äù has long abandoned me and shamed or ridiculed me for being different, lazy, or a slacker.

I‚Äôve dealt with addiction‚Äîmainly hash, which was the only thing that quieted the noise in my head and let me enjoy moments. I quit everything in November last year, including SSRIs, but haven‚Äôt improved.

The world feels unstable, especially now with AI and rapid change. The usual advice‚Äî‚Äúget a job,‚Äù ‚Äútry hobbies,‚Äù ‚Äúbuild skills‚Äù‚Äîfeels insane or meaningless when everything feels so uncertain. I‚Äôve tried pushing myself to do something, but it always seems to backfire. Traditional jobs, in particular, leave me miserable. I can‚Äôt lie to myself about it anymore‚ÄîI can‚Äôt go back to the mindless loop of going to a place I hate just to get paid scraps that I then spend during the month. I‚Äôve realized I‚Äôm even spending money just around work‚Äîtransportation, lunch, etc. It feels pointless and offers me nothing in return.

Does this sound like autistic burnout? How do you even start moving forward when your brain and body are shut down, motivation feels impossible, and everything feels so overwhelming?

Any honest insight or shared experience would help. Thanks for reading.

title: hyperfixations became a problem for me
text:
vent-ish i don‚Äôt know. 


i talk about my hyperfixations too much..way more when i was a teenager because now i‚Äôve kind of learned to stfu but i still get way too excited about them and it‚Äôs a problem. i end up crossing boundaries by talking about hyperfixations at the wrong time or to the wrong people, and i end up unintentionally hurting them. then i only realize how weird it was later on. i literally unintentionally ended a 5 year friendship once because i was so insistent on showing off my hyperfixation to them at the time. i don‚Äôt really have friends now but i fantasize about talking about and showing off my hyperfixations to random people, and then i feel like a weirdo. when i actually get to talk about my hyperfixations with someone, the shameful feeling overpowers and idk why. then i wonder why did i talk about that stuff, i look like a loser, and for some reason don‚Äôt feel excited to share about my hyperfixations anymore.

title: Adult topics are always avoided around me.
text:
(NSFW)


Any kind of adult topic is always avoided around me and i don‚Äôt know why. As long as i can remember things like sex, periods, sex toys, masturbation and just anything of that sort, has not been mentioned around me. Even tho i am 18 years old now, they only use facial expressions to signal these words??? like that‚Äôs a low blow when they know i struggle with facial expressions(figured them out anyways lol) i feel so awkward because i know if i blurted out the word sex everyone‚Äôs head would turn to me like this:üòß.

does anyone else experience this? this has happened before i even got my autism diagnosis which was only a few months ago. I think it might be because i have always been very shy and never brought up the topics as a child because i guess i‚Äôm ashamed to talk about them. I just think it‚Äôs silly because i‚Äôm 18 now. My cousin also came to the conclusion that i don‚Äôt know what sex is.. ugh i feel like this has become a bigger issue since i got my diagnosis pls tell me i‚Äôm not alone

title: Gyms
text: How in the world are we supposed to go to the gym? I can‚Äôt workout at home because I‚Äôm only supposed to use machines to force good form after spine surgery but I might combust in here. I have noise canceling AirPods in but I can feel the vibration of the music and the lights are so awful I‚Äôd like to rip out my nervous system and slam in on the ground to calm down. I can feel it in the back of my neck and traps.
